page.title: 11BENENDEN WEALD, MILKING.
page.content: At Forest Farm all milking used to be done by hand, the cows stood in pairs in the milking shed. The milk was put into 10 gallon churns and then taken to Ashford. Jersey cows were used. Now they have changed to the shorthorn cow because it is better for beef. The cows are now milked by machine and they stand singly in the milking shed. The cows can be put through a foot bath which hardens their feet, before this they had to have their feet trimmed. Once the cow is milked the milk goes into a tank where the amount is recorded and a computer works out how much food that individual cow should have. The milk then goes into a large refrigerated tank. Some can be made into cream using a traditional machine with 19 discs.
